1.description: First, create the blade, which will serve as the primary cutting edge and define the overall shape of the knife. This component is crucial as it establishes the functional purpose of the object, ensuring that it can effectively perform its intended task of slicing and cutting.

2.description: Next, attach the handle to the base of the blade, ensuring it is securely fastened to provide a comfortable grip for the user. This handle not only aids in maneuverability and control while using the object but also serves to balance the overall structure, enhancing both functionality and ergonomics.

3.description: Finally, add the butt at the end of the handle to provide a finished appearance and enhance the balance of the knife. This component not only offers a comfortable grip for the user but also serves to secure the handle and blade assembly, ensuring stability during use.
